alternatives.transcript: this is the CBS Evening News Dan Rather reporting a major flare-up in the Tobacco Wars The Tobacco industry is under attack as never before anti-smoking organizations are hurling vicious charges about the industry's advertising and marketing practices recent hearings on Capitol Hill and media coverage of providing platforms for these anti-tobacco charges Congressman Thomas Lukens tone of such rhetoric as seen at a recent hearing of his subcommittee on
transportation and hazardous materials is one example that I must insist that
cigarettes are drugs and that they are more harmful or at least as harmful as those drugs which are illegal
unfortunately I must make an observation here unfortunately these advertisers are all employed by the tobacco industry

we have to recognize a conflict of interest I debated the Leadership Council and television yesterday that's a euphemism for a bunch of advertising agencies that are subsidized by the tobacco industry

so I must question the objectivity or the impartiality of the advertising industry and even the civil liberties Union's that have come in here but the open checkbook of the tobacco industry I think is an influence upon our society and it's one that we must in fact recognize even cabinet secretaries of jumped onto the bandwagon Health and Human Services secretary Louis Sullivan has grabbed onto

Brass Ring lambasting the promotion of tobacco through athletic events his latest Target the Virginia Slims tennis tournament when the tobacco industry sponsors an event in order to push a deadly product they are trading on the health and on The Prestige and the image of the athlete to bother a product that will kill for user this blood money should not be used

to foster a misleading impression that smoking is compatible with good health others have echoed dr. Sullivan sentiments I think tobacco money is blood money here pure and simple at all times I agree with secretary Sullivan I would not Advocate anyone accepting tobacco money period this is an advertisement
to encourage a 14 year old

to use tobacco and I would just observe that when RJ R is using this very sophisticated Direct Mail campaign to push an addictive narcotic on 14 year olds in this country we should all be concerned this kind of advertising that is targeted to to 14 year olds as I have indicated to you today is absolutely unacceptable and if the industry does not stop this immediately

I am convinced that the Congress of the United States is going to move in and do whatever is constitutionally permissible to restrict it the tobacco industry has engaged in a fierce competition for the lungs of young women the tobacco industry works hard to pretend that their advertising campaigns convey valuable information to Consumers and that they enjoy unlimited protection for commercial speech under the US Constitution neither of these assertions is true not only does the industry

Italy obfuscate the information that consumers need but the industry deliberately confuses the full protection that is granted to an individual's political Free Speech under the First Amendment with the very limited recognition given to a corporation's right to advertise tobacco companies
have made an Earnest effort certainly to Target the Hispanic market generally but more specifically the Hispanic youth Market

advertising directly to disadvantaged commit communities play on the aspirations and desires of the poor by associating smoking with positive and desirable things well style attractiveness popularity and sometimes even health and Athletics we are already more vulnerable
and the tobacco industry has continued to Target our communities knowing that the market are the Hispanic youth Market is out there

all tobacco advertising is harmful so what makes Billboards unique several things first they are impossible to ignore the public is a captive audience particularly children to Billboards which which unlike other advertisements cannot be eliminated at the flip of the switch or turn of a page they are simply there 24 hours a day everyday promoting their messages the use powerful images of sex
glamour athletic achievement to sell the notion that smoking and drinking equate with success excetera
the problem as I purchase it is particularly unique in inner-city neighborhood the last comment I want to make is that Billboards are unique

advertising medium in terms of the legality and constitutionality of Regulation there's been a great deal of discussion here today about First Amendment protections for advertising and we talking about the controlling of the placement of billboards were talking about a time place and manner restriction on speech

control over the placement of billboards is a central element any program to protect children from tobacco advertising we believe that Tombstone advertising is not enough we believe that there should be a Prohibition on any tobacco advertising within 1,000 feet of any school park playground Youth Center Church or other place where children might grab gather further we think that the committee should consider the prohibition of tobacco advertising on federally funded mass transit systems and it should require that warning labels

on Billboard's be enlarged so that they can be read as they are intended to be read even the Senate has gotten into the ACT there were more anti-tobacco attacks at a hearing of Senator Edward Kennedy's committee on labor and Human Resources we can't sit idly by any longer while tobacco companies cynically devised marketing campaigns to lower the most vulnerable groups into a life of nicotine addiction addiction smoking is public health Enemy Number One in America today we're not seriously
us about public health unless we get serious about reducing tobacco abuse while the anti-smoking activists will surely continue their Crusade the tobacco industry will continue to defend its position
